snippet: Critics say the law will suppress job growth, but economists say it is too soon tell whether businesses will cut hours or hire more part-timers to skirt the employer mandate.
abstract: Critics say the health care reform law will suppress job growth, but economists say it is too soon tell whether businesses will cut hours or hire more part-timers to skirt the employer mandate.

byline.original: By ANNIE LOWREY and JOHN HARWOOD

lead_paragraph: Critics say the law will suppress job growth, but economists say it is too soon tell whether businesses will cut hours or hire more part-timers to skirt the employer mandate.

headline.main: Despite Criticisms, Health Care Law’s Impact on Jobs Is Still Unclear
headline.print_headline: Despite Criticisms, Health Care Law’s Impact on Jobs Is Still Unclear

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
